results.title: Three New Directors Welcome the Freedoms of Horror
results.abstract: The filmmakers Prano Bailey-Bond (“Censor”), S.K. Dale (“Till Death”) and Sean King O’Grady (“We Need to Do Something”) discuss the joys and the fears of having their first features be horror movies.

results.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda Addresses ‘In the Heights’ Casting Criticism
results.abstract: Since the film’s release last week, there have been complaints about the lack of dark-skinned Afro-Latino actors in prominent roles.

multimedia.caption: After criticism that the film adaptation of “In the Heights” lacked dark-skinned actors in prominent roles, Lin-Manuel Miranda said, “I can hear the hurt and frustration over colorism, of feeling still unseen.” He attended the film’s premiere, in Washington Heights.
multimedia.copyright: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: After criticism that the film adaptation of “In the Heights” lacked dark-skinned actors in prominent roles, Lin-Manuel Miranda said, “I can hear the hurt and frustration over colorism, of feeling still unseen.” He attended the film’s premiere, in Washington Heights.

results.title: Baron Davis Directs Now. If There’s a ‘Space Jam 3,’ He Wants In.
results.abstract: The former N.B.A. star’s first movie, “Domino: Battle of the Bones,” is as in-your-face as his playing style. And he’s got plenty more big-screen ideas.

multimedia.caption: In addition to studying books on directing, Davis spent time with Spike Lee and other filmmakers while making commercials, and came away thinking, “Yo, you know what? I can do this.”
multimedia.copyright: G L Askew II for The New York Times

results.title: Lizzie Borden’s ‘Working Girls’ Is About Capitalism, Not Sex
results.abstract: While the 1987 drama takes place in a Manhattan brothel, its true concern is labor. (And it’s is definitely not to be confused with Mike Nichols’s rom-com.)

multimedia.caption: A scene from Lizzie Borden’s “Working Girls.” The 1987 drama is notable for its measured structure, analytical camera placement and straightforward cool.
A scene from Lizzie Borden’s “Working Girls.” The 1987 drama is notable for its measured structure, analytical camera placement and straightforward cool.

results.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda responde a las críticas sobre el elenco de ‘In the Heights’
results.abstract: La película generó malestar por presentar actores latinos de piel clara en los papeles principales, a pesar de la prevalencia de latinos de piel oscura en el barrio donde se rodó.

multimedia.caption: Tras las críticas por la falta de actores de piel oscura en papeles destacados en la adaptación cinematográfica de In the Heights, Lin-Manuel Miranda dijo: “Puedo escuchar el dolor y la frustración por el colorismo, por sentirse aún no visto”. Asistió al estreno de la película, en Washington Heights.
multimedia.copyright: Nina Westervelt para The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Tras las críticas por la falta de actores de piel oscura en papeles destacados en la adaptación cinematográfica de In the Heights, Lin-Manuel Miranda dijo: “Puedo escuchar el dolor y la frustración por el colorismo, por sentirse aún no visto”. results.title: Ned Beatty, Actor Known for ‘Network’ and ‘Deliverance,’ Dies at 83
results.abstract: In a career that spanned more than four decades and more than 150 movie and TV roles, Mr. Beatty was rarely the star but almost always made a strong impression.

multimedia.caption: Ned Beatty in 2003. He was rarely cast in leading roles, but he was associated with some of Hollywood’s most enduring films.
Ned Beatty in 2003. He was rarely cast in leading roles, but he was associated with some of Hollywood’s most enduring films.

results.title: Milton Moses Ginsberg, 85, Unconventional Filmmaker, Dies
results.abstract: His movies about a psychiatrist’s disintegration and a werewolf in the White House originally bombed, but they both drew favorable attention many years later.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “The Werewolf of Washington,” Milton Moses Ginsberg’s 1973 political parody, which starred Dean Stockwell as a White House official who turns into a werewolf.

results.title: A Film Tries to Make a Difference for Domestic Violence Survivors
results.abstract: “And So I Stayed” examines how the courts treat women who kill their abusers. The movie played a role in one case that resulted in freedom after a conviction.
